September 3, 2000: Fiction
WINTER SOLSTICE, by Rosamunde Pilcher. (Thomas Dunne/ St. Martin's,
$27.95.) As Christmas approaches, five lost souls in the north of Scotland discover
the healing power of love.
DUST TO DUST, by Tami Hoag. (Bantam, $25.95.) Two Minneapolis police
officers investigate the suspicious death of an Internal Affairs cop.
THE HOUSE ON HOPE STREET, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $19.95.) A
woman with five children must cope with the loss of her husband, who dies on
Christmas Day.
STALKER, by Faye Kellerman. (Morrow, $25.) While Peter Decker of the L.A.P.D.
is distracted by a string of brutal carjackings, someone is terrorizing his daughter,
a rookie on the force.
NOT A DAY GOES BY, by E. Lynn Harris. (Doubleday, $19.95.) The tumultuous
romance between a football player turned sports agent and an up-and-coming
Broadway star.
PURPLE CANE ROAD, by James Lee Burke. (Doubleday, $24.95.) Dave
Robicheaux, a Louisiana sheriff's deputy, searches for his mother's killers.
OMERTA, by Mario Puzo. (Random House, $25.95.) An F.B.I. agent targets a
recently retired Mafia don who has tried to shield his three grown children from the
family business.
MR. PERFECT, by Linda Howard. (Pocket Books, $24.95.) After four women
compile a list of the attributes an ideal man would possess, one of them is
murdered.
RIPTIDE, by Catherine Coulter. (Putnam, $23.95.) The senior speechwriter for the
governor of New York flees a stalker as well as the police after her boss is shot.
THE INDWELLING, by Tim LaHaye and Jerry B. Jenkins. (Tyndale, $22.99.)
Volume 7 in a series about true believers who confront the Antichrist after the
rapture of the saved.
THE BRETHREN, by John Grisham. (Doubleday, $27.95.) Three former judges,
doing time at a federal prison in Florida, concoct a mail scam that goes awry.
NORA, NORA, by Anne Rivers Siddons. (HarperCollins, $25.) An outsider who
harbors a secret from her past shakes up the quiet town of Lytton, Ga.
HOT SIX, by Janet Evanovich. (St. Martin's, $24.95.) A New Jersey bounty hunter
searches for her mentor, who is the No. 1 suspect in the killing of an arms dealer's
son.
September 3, 2000
Non-Fiction
IT'S NOT ABOUT THE BIKE, by Lance Armstrong with Sally Jenkins. (Putnam,
$24.95.) A memoir by the Tour de France champion and cancer survivor.
TUESDAYS WITH MORRIE, by Mitch Albom. (Doubleday, $19.95.) The author
tells of his weekly visits to his old college mentor, who was near death's door.
LIFE ON THE OTHER SIDE, by Sylvia Browne with Lindsay Harrison. (Dutton,
$23.95.) A guided tour of the afterlife, by a "working psychic."
ME TALK PRETTY ONE DAY, by David Sedaris. (Little, Brown, $22.95.) A
collection of autobiographical comic essays by the author of "Naked."
FLAGS OF OUR FATHERS, by James Bradley with Ron Powers. (Bantam,
$24.95.) The story of the six men who raised the flag at Iwo Jima, by the son of
one of them.
AMERICAN RHAPSODY, by Joe Eszterhas. (Knopf, $25.95.) The Lewinsky affair
and Hollywood, as seen by the man who wrote "Basic Instinct" and "Showgirls."
IN THE HEART OF THE SEA, by Nathaniel Philbrick. (Viking, $24.95.) An account
of the whaleship Essex, whose disastrous fate would later serve as inspiration for
Herman Melville.
IN A SUNBURNED COUNTRY, by Bill Bryson. (Broadway, $25.) The author of "A
Walk in the Woods" reports on his travels through Australia.
KITCHEN CONFIDENTIAL, by Anthony Bourdain. (Bloomsbury, $24.95.) A
memoir-expose by the executive chef at Brasserie Les Halles in New York.
FROM DAWN TO DECADENCE, by Jacques Barzun. (HarperCollins, $36.) A
survey of 500 years of Western cultural life, from 1500 to the present.
THE GREATEST GENERATION, by Tom Brokaw. (Random House, $24.95.) The
lives of men and women who came of age during the Depression and World War
II.
THE ART OF HAPPINESS, by the Dalai Lama and Howard C. Cutler. (Riverhead,
$22.95.) What Buddhism and common sense tell us about everyday problems.
THE DAY JOHN DIED, by Christopher Andersen. (Morrow, $26.) The events
leading up to the plane crash that killed John F. Kennedy Jr., Carolyn Bessette
Kennedy and Lauren Bessette.
CONVERSATIONS WITH GOD: Book 1, by Neale Donald Walsch. (Putnam,
$19.95.) The author addresses questions of good and evil, guilt and sin.
